channel.title: At School in 70S England on UN-aligned
channel.description: Recent content in At School in 70S England on UN-aligned

item.title: "All of the anger poured out of me like a volcano and I saw red"
item.author: rubygoldenberg
item.description: Noor is sharing her experience as an immigrant child who came to England in the 70s from Morocco. At the time, Noor was still grappling with the English language and finding her place in High School. This is the third and final part of Noor's story.

item.title: “No, I wasn’t somebody just to be picked on”
item.author: rubygoldenberg
item.description: This is the second part of Noor’s story. Noor is sharing her experience as an immigrant child who came to England in the 70s from Morocco. At the time, Noor was still grappling with the English language and finding her place in High School.

item.title: “I couldn't understand a word of it, but I loved choir singing”
item.author: rubygoldenberg
item.description: Noor shares her experience as an immigrant child who came to England in the 70s from Morocco. At the time, she didn’t speak a word of English and was thrust into the British Primary School education system.
